notes: regular -ere verb; past participle 'scorso'; auxiliary avere or essere depending on usage
example_sentence_english: I want to scroll through the list.
I am scrolling through the document.
Time has passed.
The current flowed quickly.

example_sentence_italian: Gli eventi scorsi hanno cambiato tutto.
example_sentence_english: Past events changed everything.
The pages I went through were interesting.
I scroll the page.
You scroll the feed.
He scrolls through the photos.
We scroll through all the entries.
You (plural) scroll through the list.
They scroll through the list.
I used to scroll those pages often.
You were scrolling the text slowly.

translation_english: he was flowing/she was flowing/you (formal) were flowing
example_sentence_italian: Lei scorreva la lista mentre parlava.
example_sentence_english: You (formal) were scrolling the list while speaking.
We were scrolling through the options together.

example_sentence_italian: Voi scorrevate le foto dal divano.
example_sentence_english: You (plural) were scrolling the photos from the sofa.
They were scrolling through the document quickly.

notes: used with auxiliary avere or essere; when used with essere past participle agrees
example_sentence_italian: Ho scorso la lista questa mattina.
example_sentence_english: I scrolled through the list this morning.
Have you scrolled through all the emails?

translation_english: he has scrolled/she has scrolled/you (formal) have scrolled
example_sentence_italian: Ha scorso il registro senza problemi.
example_sentence_english: He has gone through the register without problems.
We have scrolled through all the options.
Have you (plural) gone through the report together?

example_sentence_italian: Hanno scorso la lista prima della riunione.
example_sentence_english: They scrolled through the list before the meeting.
